description: From Middle English ugsom, equivalent to ug +â€Ž -some.

adjectives.description: ugsome (comparative more ugsome, superlative most ugsome)

entries.meaning: (chiefly UK dialectal, Scotland, Northern England) Ugly; horrible; disgusting; offensive, loathsome, repellent.
examples: We have italicised the more ugsome parts of the S.S.C. paper so that those of our readers who are too busy mountaineering to read the whole thing may grasp the fundamental psychopathology of the unattractive predators that have battened onto us.
